comments.body: i think they could easily implement this as well by using the same system they have for large chests. well if not the same it would be similar. i really think this should be base feature and not from a mod. would be a very nice quality of life change that everyone would appreciate
Hi
I like the idea, but they still should stick to other colors, because that doesn’t make much sense, plus, there’s already honey.
i was thinking the same thing except for the same colour aspect. it would be nice for making flying machines and other such things where the green just doesn't fit in.

you might want to say to put them around an oases which could be in a desert . We could combine lots of ideas and get an oasis with fruit bushes and palm trees. Additionally, parrots could live there and bunnies and more animals.
picture please!

two things: first, you can already change diamond blocks back to diamonds. Second, there would be some problem with uncrafting stuff that gives more than one item, like where a log crafts into 4 planks, and you give 7 blocks to get 4 stairs (which could lead to an exploit where you make stairs in a stonecutter and unmake them in the un-crafting table). It would have to be two crafting grids on the top and bottom so you can arrange the multiple items.
y voto eh me parece un genial idea :)
Tienes mi apoyo :)
Incredible idea!!!!!

I would like to use it because I have like no iron in my world yet so much iron armour but obviously this will make the game easy so I think it should be hard to craft like 4 iron or iron and gold just some mid-game to early game items so that people can undo mistakes like i accidentally make 40 iron boots and have no iron or if you wanna go above and beyond make it a villager job! Also if someone wants to un-craft armour it should be relative to the durability or to make life simple just half the amount if there is low durability

I like this idea. I think when you place a plaque on the floor, it should stay on the floor facing up like an item frame, but they should be angled up a bit like a lectern so you can glance down and read them without having to standing directly on top of it. The same applies to putting them on ceilings, they would be angled down for readability so you don't have to look straight up. 

This would give it its own purposes apart from being a metal textured sign, so it can be useful in its own situations
This would be great for making monuments too, or cemeteries, unless they add stone carving too.
I absolutely love this idea! It would definitely help more with building statues or monoliths or things like that!

I'd imagine the plaques having those bolts in each corner of the texture!

Would love if it let you place plaques flat on the floor or underside of a block, almost like a trapdoor. It would differentiate it from signs, where you can't place them facing up!

Bonus: Because minecraft lets you use unicode, that means it would be awesome for creating tile patterns or wallpaper using funky symbols like these
✦❘༻༺❘✦✦❘༻༺❘✦✦❘༻༺❘✦
using maps+item frames for wallpaper is super inefficient because of the performance lag it causes, so it would be great to have an alternative!
Give examples for us who don't play it.

examples include dirty cobble, soil, swampy soil, stone tiles, skull stone, fall-like blocks, burnt stone variants, cracked and mossy stone variants, sandy stone variants, snowy stone variants, grassy course dirt, grassy soil, swampy grassy soil, wood variants, rope, dirt and grass slabs, and much more.
I absolutely love and support this idea imagine all the builds we could make with more variants of blocks!
What about just repairing them
kool idea

I think what MoonsOverMySam means is that the Fletching Table, which now serves only to give villagers a profession, could be made functional to the player itself; e.g. by allowing the player to upgrade a bow to one of a stronger material. For this, new items would need to be added to the game.
Optionally the enchantment buffs that are specific to (cross)bows and that now are imbued by means of an enchanting table or an anvil+book could be added here as well.

Oh how about also have 2 slots like the anvil
And it also Craft The Target Block using less resources , use1 redstone torch &1 haybale to make target block and also use the fetching table to make effect points arrows .for 1 arrow + 1 potion
I think you mean Warped Fungus, as there is no Blue Nether Wart. Unless, that is also a part of your suggestion, but just didn't state that.
yeah I did mean the warped wart that was a typo

I completely agree with you. This would have to be somewhat difficult to charge and craft however, maybe using one Ender Crystal surrounded by Crying Obsidian. Idk how I'd want to charge it though, maybe using an Ender Rod?
Hopefully we will get something like this if the End is ever updated!

The only problem with this is that, in order to be balanced, it would have to be obtained after defeating the enderdragon at least once. if there was a way to respawn when fighting the dragon for the first time it would be kind of overpowered
I gotten an idea It should be crafted with 6 endstone and 3 chorus fruit. Making it only possible after you defeated the ender dragon. And To charge it up You need to use chorus fruit.
I think it would be fine if you have it and then use it to respawn whilst fighting the Ender Dragon. It could be made to be impervious to the Dragon, but it could also be destroyed to make it easier.
I would have the block have an Eye of Ender on all sides. Each power level of the block would open the eye from closed to wide open. It could have some bedrock and End Portal/Gateway textures on it.
I was thinking that Ender Pearls could be used to charge it up, but they would be fairly common in the End, so I am not sure. On the other hand, glowstone is pretty common in the Nether...

Eyes of Ender could be used to charge it up. In the same way that the Eye of Ender in the End Crystal recipe is what guides the beam to the Ender Dragon, the Eye of Ender in this recipe would guide the player to the Respawn Anchor when they die
It could also resemble the End Portal Frames a bit, or maybe endstone and Purpur blocks

If Ender Pearls are used to charge it up, the explanation could simply be that it stores the Ender Pearls until the player dies. In fact, this block could be called an Ender Pearl Stasis Chamber, or End Chamber. It would also be cool if it could be activated without dying, but that may be too OP

The Dragon Egg could be used in this, either as a feature or in the recipe for this block. I think it would make sense, as if YOU are being hatched from the egg. On the other hand, it would only be for one player, unless Dragon Eggs are made renewable

We don't need a new block for specifically respawning in the End. We should just be able to use the current respawn anchor for the End too. Most players probably wouldn't want to deal with 2 different types of respawning systems with different ingredients to do it. Just make it simple like MC usually is. The Nether & the End are related anyways. And beds already explode the same way a respawn anchor currently does in the End, so no 1 is going to detonate respawn anchors instead of beds. Until we ever get a new dimension in the far future, there's no reason to have more than 1 respawn anchor.
OK let's say that the anchor work for both for both, what about the bed then? Shouldn't the bed act as a spawn point for all dimesions. I'm sorry but another new block have to be made.
This!! Especially with the new Echo Shards, there's a new way to bring this into the game unique from the Nether version and the Overworld's beds
You got this from Systemzee which is good because I really want some of his ideas in the game
this is a pretty good idea maybe it could look like purple iron, but the void idea is a bit outrageous
I like the idea, but I think where the end steel will go needs to be changed

I agree with MythicFunk. Maybe a new storage block needs to be added that will only be filled with End Steel armor, weapons, and tools when you die? Kind of like a respawn anchor for your items. 

I really like the End Steel idea. It could really improve the End in a possible End Update, cause that dimension is pretty boring right now. No reason to stick around there after you grab some elytra.

What's the point in an end ore? You've already killed the dragon, so why get stronger? People might say "to kill the wither" but my problem is that the wither should be a mid-game boss considering they're from the nether (the fact that people spawn them in the overworld doesn't make it an overworld boss, it's from the nether because they come from wither skeletons.
I think it should be as good as Netherite but gives speed and slow-falling so people who operate in the Nether choose Netherite but people who operate in the End choose End Steel.
What I'd the Ender Chest is full?
but if it falls into void and goes to ur ender chest that might be too OP

The illusioner is an unused mob and there is no way to get him without using commands. Therefore, I do not think this will be approved, because, if you use the illusioner in some sort of mini-game, you might as well as implement the loot table for the "All Seeing Eye" (and an use for it)
They should find a way to include the illusioner, and I (or should I say "eye", pun intended) think that the whole eating the eye is too weird, so yeah, perception potion.
This belongs on items and blocks
This is a thing on Java, and this should be moved to the Parity category with (Java Parity) included at the beginning of the title.
I didn't  know where to put enchantments, so I figured here would be the best spot.
You're in the right place my friend. :D

It would be better as

Vampirism, or Absorb : Depending on level you regain part of your health (with a certain probability)

Leeching : A bad enchanting, curse, for armors, that hurts you over time. Like half a heart every 100 tick with a probability of 10, 20, 30 up to 50 percent. We need more curses, like vanishing or binding.
well I feel like the enchantment should actually have a 50-50 chance of actually healing the player when attacking hostile mobs
I think that this should only be applicable to items that are held and not thrown, as if the health has a path back to the player
An enchantment could hurt entities and heal the player while a curse could hurt the player but do more damage to the mob, like a reverse Thorns.

The character limit is a bit strict, anyway here's my thoughts on why I think this would be a good addition:

It's obvious at this point that Mojang prefer unique additions, not some basic food like lettuce every second mod adds. The ghastmallow would be good for the game as it has a lot of potential use cases. Also they add a new use for the ghast tear which is one of the least used items in the game. Most importantly I think they help alleviate the issue with the hunger system in the game at the moment, and that is almost every food is overshadowed by more efficient and effective options? Ever had a stack of pumpkin pie in your inventory? Me neither. Food with unique uses are needed and older foods (especially pork chops) need a bit of a rework.

Also its not showing the pictures on my end so if that's an issue here's an album! https://imgur.com/a/D4FHQwM
I like the idea with the Pigmen. Maybe the it will also make them follow you or protect you (because of the high price point with the ghost tears)? That may be obscenely broken, but we can dream.
This is amazing. It would also add a unique use to the campfire.

Great Idea!

I think this would look a lot better.
That's too overpowered!

We already have forms of soup and stew in the game. sorry, but you don’t have my support.
So you could just give yourself a full bar of saturation just by one food item.
You say we don't need it too complicated but yet you made a recipe that is more complicated then any other food recipe.
Why would steak be in the recipe?

My idea is you craft a cauldron with a campfire to create something to cook the stew in. You fill it with water and then put in different ingredients such as meats, mushrooms, and vegetables. Adding milk could make it creamy soup. You have a minimum of 2 ingredients and a maximum of 4 ingredients. After putting the ingredients in, you wait for a little while and the stew will start bubbling. You can take the stew out with a bowl, and you have enough for several bowls, like in a normal cauldron. The amount of food points it restores depends on the types of ingredients.
the stew already exsists in minecraft

Garlic plants could deter undead mobs within a small radius. Maybe combine it with WackyWaldo71's idea of getting garlic or onions from allium flowers. Could get both of them, RNG determines if an allium drops just itself, or an onion or a garlic.
you should also be able to break a garlic head into 6 cloves and surround bread with 8 coves to get garlic bread

Garlic powder – Minecraft Feedback
i love this idea!!!!!!
This is a great idea. you get a cookie!
I feel like freeze potions could come from a blizzard mob. You kill it,it drops an item that you use in potions.

I believe that freezing should reduce attack speed.
Don't touch the camera sensitivity because players will just use macros.
I think the same thing but the armor should give us a water breathing effect if I have the whole set on

I think this is a pretty good idea, but too limited.  The Turtle Shell is already tougher than all but the Diamond Helm.  Rather than making the turtle armor completely overpowered combat-wise (Diamond Armor is already ridiculously OP in combat), Turtle armor pieces could follow the theme of the Turtle Shell.  Turtle Chestpiece, Leggings, and Boots could affect our ability to do things underwater.  Increased underwater walking speed, increased swim speed, increased mining speed, or other similar ideas.
Yes please give us a compleat armour set, It Will be awesome have 7 types of amours stants (incluiding the new netherite) I think it give us more things to do in game.

I think maybe there could be a whole armour set and when you have the full set THEN you get the effects such as water breathing moving faster in water,they should also make it so when you have the full set sea grass can now become edible to the player ,and you get an achievement for it (name could probably be "Turtle Power!" either when you get the full set or when you eat sea grass)or something,but it should also have a downside such as when you get out of the water you get the slowness effect instead because the turtles move way slower when they are on the beaches, therefore giving the armour both an upside and a downside.
What if you take a turtle armour piece and combine it with a new prismarine ingot to re inforse it to not wear as fast, but still do the same protection.  The look could be very cool.
I agree

The chestplate should cover the front, giving you the option to combine the chestplate with elytras. This chestplate wouldn't be so effective as other armor pices but would give you some cover when using elytra.

maybe it could also work as a movable light source , i mean the fireflies are lighting up the night sky and the air and flying around , it would only make sense that if when you hold it , it would emit it's light source , and maybe it could change depending on how many fireflies are in the jar? (plus a movable light source just would be really nice , it could be balanced out by how faint of light fireflies would give off kinda like a glow

maybe it could even be a continuous faint light source even when you have darkness affect? or imagine being able to open up the bottle/jar and let the fireflies fly out , i hope the fireflies are actual entities cuz it will add alot of new possibilities!
Yes!!!!!!!! I would love this addition to the game. It would add a cool use to fireflies and would be an awesome light source!! 😃👍

the potential increased food point consumption is extremely controversial, I am aware. I just think it is a cool idea to add more strategy and fairness to the game without the nonsense that is speed reductions.
